title: AdditionalFilter
description: An optical filter is a device that selectively transmits light of different wavelengths. This element refers to a filter positioned along the light path in addition to the excitation and the emission filters.This element can be associated with an optional FilterWheel - Note: FilterWheel is not the same as a FilterSet.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., manufacturer name, model designation and serial number).
subCategoriesOrder.FIlter: This describes an optical filter positioned in the light path for one or more channel available for this instrument. An optical filter is a device that selectively transmits light of different wavelengths. An instrument may have several filters of different types, such as an excitation, an emission filter or an additional filter positioned in the light path for different purposes. For each fluorescence Image there should be at least one filter element specified per Channel. This element can be associated with an optional FilterWheel - Note: FilterWheel is not the same as a FilterSet.
subCategoriesOrder.AdditionalFilter: An optical filter is a device that selectively transmits light of different wavelengths. This element refers to a filter positioned along the light path in addition to the excitation and the emission filters.This element can be associated with an optional FilterWheel - Note: FilterWheel is not the same as a FilterSet.
subCategoriesOrder.TransmittanceRange: This records the range of wavelengths that are transmitted by the filter. It also records the maximum amount of light transmitted. Multiple of this elements can be used.

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Type.description: The type of filter used in this case.

ReflectionCoating.description: An optical coating is one or more thin layers of material deposited on an optical component such as a lens or mirror, which alters the way in which the optic reflects and transmits light.

FilterWheel.description: This can can refer to any arrangement of filters in a filter holder of any shape. It could, for example, be a filter slider.

TransmittanceProfileFile.description: This contains the location of file in .csv or other suitable formats containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of this component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of this component

SpecsFile.description: Provide the location of a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer.

TransmittanceRange.description: This records the range of wavelengths that are transmitted by the filter. It also records the maximum amount of light transmitted. Multiple of this elements can be used.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

Transmittance.description: The maximum amount of light this optical component is capable of transmitting at the peak wavelenght. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.
